financial_benefits.description: The Cayman Islands does not impose local income tax on foreign-sourced income for digital nomads.
The Cayman Islands Dollar (KYD) provides a stable financial environment.

lifestyle_benefits.description: Enjoy a tropical marine climate with warm temperatures year-round.
The Cayman Islands offers a high standard of living with beautiful beaches and a strong financial sector.

additional_benefits.description: English is the official language, making communication easy for most expatriates.
The country is known for its excellent diving spots and outdoor recreational activities.

key_consideration: The Global Citizen Concierge Program (GCCP) allows remote workers to live and work in the Cayman Islands for up to two years with no local tax on foreign income.
action_comment: Consider the Cayman Islands for its stable financial environment, beautiful landscapes, and diverse cultural attractions.
tagline: Work and live in paradise in the Cayman Islands.
tax_residency_trigger_details: You are considered a tax resident if you stay for longer than 183 days in a calendar year.

visas.key_consideration: The visa can be renewed for another two years by reapplying.

income_requirement.misc_details: Minimum annual salary requirement: $100,000 for individuals, $150,000 for couples, and $180,000 for an adult or couple with children.

application_fee.details: The application fee is $1469 per year for individuals and an extra $500 per dependent per year.

visas.renewability_details: The visa can be renewed for another two years by reapplying.
visas.permanent_residency_details: The digital nomad visa does not lead to permanent residency.

special_regimes.name: Digital Nomad Visa
special_regimes.benefit: No income tax on foreign-sourced income.
eligibility: Proof of employment or self-employment outside the Cayman Islands.
Valid police clearance from the past 6 months.
Health insurance covering the duration of stay.

required_documents: Proof of Employment or Income – a letter showing your proof that you are employed by a company outside the Cayman Islands, your position in the company, length of employment, and annual salary.
Proof of Legal Existence of Employer or Company – a Certificate of Incorporation or Registration Certificates of the company comes along with websites and social media profiles.
Proof of Applicant’s Identity – a photocopy of your passport.
Bank Reference – for the last 6 months.
Police Clearance – it should be issued within the last 6 months from the last place where you lived for over 6 months.
Proof of Health Insurance – request only for the first 30 days upon your arrival.

visas.key_consideration: Long term visa options for stays exceeding one year.
